website_summaries.verdict: One of the most highly rated backpacks from the brand, this all-purpose pack is sure to impress.
pros: Includes one large zippered compartment alongside two front pockets for smaller items
Side pocket great for holding water bottles and bike locks
cons: Many customers complain the bag is far too large for daily commuting needs

customer_reviews.title: Great commuter bag with minimal fuss
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a tank, like all Timbuk2 stuff. Tons of pockets and interior spaces and I have total confidence in the laptop pocket to keep my Macbook safe on the DC Metro every day. It's a bit smaller than I expected, but still plenty big enough for a day's worth of supplies and computer gear. Straps a very comfortable and the cross chest straps are removable and repositionable for a number of different heights. The straps are really durable, too. They connect to the bag with super heavyweight material, and I can't see them ever working loose or fraying. A bulletproof bag for commuting or travel.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best commuter bag out there right now
customer_reviews.text: This bag has all of it's stars for a reason. The design is thoughtful and durable. Although it has many pocket options, they don't feel busy and overwhelming. It's appearance is simple and can look casual at the coffee shop or classier for a meeting. I like the side handle that allows you to hold it as a breif case. The laptop sleeve that only unzips halfway is a nice touch as it does not have the option to fly open all the way at the weight of the rest of your bag. My computer always feels secure.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: slim slim slim
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a minimalist backpack that is big enough for your laptop and a few personal items but will also easily fit under an airplane seat, this is a great option. It's small. You aren't going to stuff a weekend's worth of clothes into this. It's not going to haul your laptop and five textbooks. But if you are looking for a place to stuff your laptop, a charger, a pair of headphones, a few magazines, your passport, a pack of gum and ... well you get the idea.
customer_reviews.author: shawndoggy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but awkward pocket
customer_reviews.text: I love the Timbuk2 brand. This is my second bag made by them but first backpack. It's very comfortable with padded straps and back. I like that the shoulder straps are able to twist a little at the connection with the bag to make getting it on and off easier. My only gripe, and I think it's a big one is that the laptop opening is a little awkward because the zipper does not open all the way across the top of the bag. They say it is for convenience and quick access to your laptop, but I find it more annoying than anything else. Had a known or paid closer attention, I may have chosen another of their bags.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pereyra

customer_reviews.title: Good for commuting, but quite small
customer_reviews.text: Nice backpack though quite small (I'm a bigger guy and my wife called it my "Dora the Explorer" backpack). It was good for crowded commuter trains but not so great for longer trips, no way to easily attach to my rolling bag and just not enough space. Very durable - took a beating in the year+ I used it and looks as good as new. I'm not commuting via train anymore (and more via plane) so switched to a larger eBags bag but could see myself using this again.
customer_reviews.author: css

customer_reviews.title: Not for 17 Inch Laptops
customer_reviews.text: This bag was stated as being compatible with 17 inch laptops. While I can cram my 17 inch laptop into this bag, I doubt it will last long with the stress that is being put on the zipper. I generally like Timbuk2 products, and this one seems to be as well built as others I have owned, but if you're looking for a backpack for a 17 inch laptop I would look elsewhere. Just for reference, my laptop is a Dell 7710.
customer_reviews.author: AET

customer_reviews.title: Looks and Feels Cheap Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this used to be a quality brand, but this bag just looks and feels like a cheap dollar store knock off. The half opening/zipping pockets is a poor design that just makes accessing your stuff more difficult. I felt that getting it half off was a good deal, but it doesn't even look like a $45 bag when in hand. If you're looking for a $100 quality back pack this is not it. If you're looking for a $20-40 back pack thats more what this thing should cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag has enough pockets to function well for everyday carrying or out of town trips. It doesn’t have so many pockets that it gets baggy & bulky. I love the dedicated charging cables pocket on the bottom. My laptop is a 17” model & it measures 16.5” x 11.5”. It’s a very nice fit. The chest connector strap snaps off, so that’s nice. I would buy this bag again & I would 100% recommend this bag to anyone in search of a bag this size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for big people.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is everything you want in a backpack. Padding, pockets, durability and pockets. Did I say pockets twice? Yeah because there’s that many pockets. Timbuk2 always has pockets upon pockets. I will however be returning it because it does not fit my frame. I’m 6’7” and it looks like I’m wearing my daughters backpack. I’d say medium build people at 6’ or below it will be a better fit. I only gave it four stars because of the size. Size matters. (thats what she said)
customer_reviews.author: Vivien Roman

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, not enough space.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack looks and feels well made, has quality zipper pulls, the front compartments are well designed and the water bottle holder has enough flex to hold a wide bottle. Unfortunately with a big gaming laptop and stuff in the front 2 pockets, the space in the center compartment is very limited. If the center pocket had a bit more room I would have kept it. If you have a lot of gear, this backpack probably isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: Miles D

customer_reviews.title: Not ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Bag has a lot of pockets but for regular use it becomes a hassle. Design is too squarish and inflexible so not comfortable for single sling. It also makes a sound when you carry it as the back of it comes into contact with your back.
customer_reviews.author: Figo

customer_reviews.title: Great bag at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I recently was looking to downsize my backpack that I was using for work. After scouring the one's available on amazon this one seemed to fit the best, small but not small, minimal but still enough quick access pockets, and professional without saying suit. I'm happy to say that it delivers on all of that and more! The only ding is the adjustability of the chest strap is kind of small, leaving it a little high for my taste (though maybe in a more ergonomic placement?). would buy again and again, especially for around 60 bucks, you'd be hard pressed to find a better bag!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spacious and classy
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is perfect, it's more spacious than it looks. I can fit my laptop, my notebooks, a water bottle, a mouse, period pads and snacks. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Clever design, good for a laptop.
customer_reviews.text: After using this every day for a few months it is holding up just fine. I carry it over one shoulder with a single strap and it works well. The pocket for your laptop has something to suspend it from resting in the bottom, I like that.
customer_reviews.author: cmeyers

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke only after 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: After light use for 6 months, the right-hand strap is tearing. I do not feel that this is a quality product
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Levin Beck

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: Well made backpack. It’s great product and would recommend it to anyone. It’s a good work backpack. I would only recommend that mug holder be located on the other side of the bag for ergonomics. I am right handed and swing my backpack to take out laptop then rotate around to take out water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: walkaboutway

customer_reviews.title: Sleek backpack but holds a lot!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my boyfriend and he loves it! He's used it daily for about 9 months and it still looks/feels brand new. It's sleek-looking, so appropriate for both school or work settings. There's a ton of pockets which allow you to store everything you could need without it looking bulky. There's even a small fleece-lined pocket, perfect for storing and protecting your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Best everyday bag I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I work in IT and as a result I’m always on the go. I purchased this bag for the single purpose of safely transporting my laptop and accessories. This bag has been amazing at going through TSA. I take it everywhere and rarely leave home without it. If you’re looking for an every day carry bag this is definitely the one.
customer_reviews.author: R G

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for office work
customer_reviews.text: Realtively quality at a good price. This is not really meant for more than your would put in a laptop case. Holds things securely and is comfortable to carry. I did find some threads sticking out, but it seems the company has started cutting corners. Knowing this, it’s worth the money (under $50)
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: Compactness
customer_reviews.text: The black is great for everyday commute , great pockets and tablet and laptop protection that doesn’t sink to the bottom of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Asquith Ballah

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop backpack—Bought 2nd for SO
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one of these bags for years, and it is fantastic. It has held up well, but I bought a second one this week. My husband finally decided to convert to a backpack and wanted one with as many places to organize your things. Luckily, this backpack is still available. It has enough room for my two laptops and plenty of other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Dana in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag. Roomy and very comfortable to carry
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bag. Very comfortable shoulder straps and curved to stay on the shoulder. Used it for travels and its very comfortable. Fits 17inch laptop too. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Faisal Y. Patel

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years and Counting
customer_reviews.text: Just realized I’ve had this bag for 3 years. I use it daily to typically carry at least a laptop, tablet, headphones, notebooks, pens, a water bottle, and whatever I feel like I need that day. It’s held up very well. There’s no fraying or holes anywhere. Overall I’ve enjoyed this bag. I wish it was waterproof bc I got caught in the rain one days and there was moisture in one of the front pockets, nothing bad just a little wet.
customer_reviews.author: David Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Great price and quality! I have had it for about 5 months now and there have been no issues pertaining to aesthetics or functionality (no loose stiching, no rips, no broken anything). One notable point is that the shoulder straps don't have much padding. That being said, I haven't had any comfort issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: Great back pack for all activities
customer_reviews.text: Sleek looking slim back pack with various compartments. I usually wear it with business attire but it looks great with all attires. The slim look is great because it never looks bulky. Overall great back pack.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The perfect backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bag and perfect material/construction. Slim design so it's not bulky. It's very firm as well. The material is a very strong nylon that feels smooth. The inner compartments have a nice plaid design that offers a nice contrast to the sleek all black design.
customer_reviews.author: Cinoy

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy compartmentalization
customer_reviews.text: Needed myself a lighter backpack than the Ful backpack I had been using, and this works! The headphone/electronics pocket is relatively isolated from the remainder of the pockets, although it hangs from the main pocket nothing squeezes it so fragile items are okay there. There are 5 pockets, and one pocket inside another pocket, which gives me plenty of compartmentalization. Haven't tried using it as a laptop bag through the TSA checkpoint, so I cannot attest to whether or not that works.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and I got for 50% off
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son. I got an eBags for my self both good quality. But this was on big sale
customer_reviews.author: John Powers

customer_reviews.title: Not just good-looking
customer_reviews.text: This bag is tremendous. Was looking for a bag for my partner who carries his laptop, lunch and a few other things and needs a streamlined but effective bag. Happy birthday to him, I bought him this bag and he LOVES it. I love that it is gorgeous and so far can hold everything he needs it to. Good job Timbuk 2.
customer_reviews.author: Teri C.

customer_reviews.title: The Timbuk 2 Q (Anchor) has the best combination of aesthetics and functionality of any backpack I have owned.
customer_reviews.text: This bag (Timbuktu Q - Anchor) is not only well designed, it actually looks good (i.e. not like your back in High School). I use it for my daily commute in NYC, and so far it has been able to withstand rain, snow, and the NYC subway. What more can one ask? If you're like me, and carry: a laptop (Macbook Pro), tablet (two iPads), exercise gear or books, then this IS the bag to get.
customer_reviews.author: Musashi

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpack, good organization possibilities just I would like ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice backpack, good organization possibilities just I would like to have some external straps to hold a jacket or sweater. Overall good construction and it feels sturdy. Very comfortable to carry even at full load. Laptop compartment it's missing a bottom padding, I added my own because I was afraid of my laptop hitting the ground , this will not happen because there's an internal "hammock" that prevents it , bit anyway I feel much more confident with the padding
customer_reviews.author: Diego S.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy user, keeps up
customer_reviews.text: After much research and disappoinment with other brands of bags, I finally settled on this pack. It fits all my needs as a student. I use this pack almost daily and keep it filled with heavy textbooks. I do not feel fatigued by it, the schoulder straps do a great job at spreading the weight. I have easy access to all my pencils, headphones, calculator, etc. The pack looks and feels great.
customer_reviews.author: eddie maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, with a slight modification.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Although the water bottle holder doesn't hold great. I overcame that issue by using a carabineer on the little tab on the pocket, it's works pretty well (see pictures).
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Novy

customer_reviews.title: Stitching coming apart
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that the stitching is already coming loose. I had great loyalty to this brand, but now I am having second thoughts. These bags are expensive and should last longer than a few months. Overall the design is good and the bag is comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: jadhack

customer_reviews.title: I use this for college and it is absolutely perfect. Coming from a 35L backpack I expected a ...
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is phenomenal and has everything I look for in a backpack. I use this for college and it is absolutely perfect. Coming from a 35L backpack I expected a little disappointment with size but quickly adapted. The laptop pocket is suspended about an inch and is padded along the backside. It fits everything I need and I could probably carry three textbooks at most (for those wondering about how big the main pocket is). Overall I gave this product 5 stars simply because of how well constructed this bag really is.
customer_reviews.author: Josef

customer_reviews.title: Great commuter bag
customer_reviews.text: Great commuter bag. Bigger than I'd expected, but my laptop is huge and I'm relatively small, so can't really complain. I really like the handle on the side. Makes it easier grab in a hurry. Looks professional enough for work.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole C Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This backpack lasted 31 months for me. Then it ripped at the top. They should have reinforced the top connection more but of course that would cost them more money to make. This backpack was great until it had to handle some actual weight and then it died on me. If a rate of 65 bucks for 2 years is appealing to you then go ahead,
customer_reviews.author: BangBangShootShoot

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack. I used to have an over the shoulder computer bag, but needed something that would hold everything and not hurt my shoulder throughout the day. It’s comfortable, protects my tech, and holds everything I used to carry in my other bags.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great service from Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. Nicer than in pictures and at a great price. But most of all the amazing service from Amazon; great information, on time and always informed about the product delivery, specially considering I am at the other side of America!!!! near the South Pole!!! Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Vicente Valjalo

customer_reviews.title: ... what I've been looking for - can be carried like a brief case
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is exactly what I've been looking for - can be carried like a brief case, but can be worn like a backpack. My only issue with it is the shoulder straps aren't quite as comfortable as I was hoping for, but I haven't had any major issues and I have stuffed this bag full and carried it around for awhile, so it may just be some primary discomfort, not long term. All of the pockets are perfect and function just the way I had hoped. Would highly recommend to anyone who needs a backpack for work.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Mabie

customer_reviews.title: I love this backpack but a serious design improvement could be ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack but a serious design improvement could be made by allowing the accessory area to unzip along the top side, middle and bottom side instead of just top and middle.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I'm picky and this bag is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years of extensive travel with a Latitude 7710 the zipper on my first bag broke. I replaced the bag with a new one and it seems like the build quality may even be better. Only complaint is the color I bought 3 years ago is discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Sather

customer_reviews.title: This is seriously the best laptop bag I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously the best laptop bag I've ever purchased. I got it on sale for only $38. It easily fits my surfacebook 2 and all the necessary peripherals, as well as most other things I'd ever want to carry around. I couldn't recommend this bag more for a work situation.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: more suited for college than middle school if your kid brings their lunch also
customer_reviews.text: Great quality bag. Its just on the small size if your student has 3 ring binders to carry like mine does. But all in all a great quality bag. I would also say if your kid backs a lunch its on the small size. More of a college bag than middle school/high school bag.
customer_reviews.author: farleyfive

customer_reviews.title: Elegantly durable.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this heavily for about a year now. Perfect pockets and quick access storage. No rips, tears, or broken buckles.
customer_reviews.author: ryan berends

customer_reviews.title: The best travel bag I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. My girlfriend purchased it for me as a gift because I travel a lot and I’ve never been happier. The bag is extremely durable with a ton of pockets for everything you could imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love my Timbuk2 bags
customer_reviews.text: Love my Timbuk2 bags. This one is just the right size and has just the right compartments. Love that you can make it look like a briefcase so I can wear it to work but still look professional.
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Toy

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to purchase the all black "updated" model
customer_reviews.text: I initially ordered the smoke option as it looked nice on the website. Upon delivery, the gray portion of the bag did not look as nice as the picture and did not feel durable at all (although I didn't test the bag by putting it into use) I returned it for the black/black model and the materials look exponentially nicer and feel like the typical tough nylon used in tb2's other awesome products. I've been using the black model now and it is great for commuting. The higher price point (more expensive than the smoke option) justifies the much better materials.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Piccoline

customer_reviews.title: It was my favorite backpack until the zipper to the main compartment broke ...
customer_reviews.text: It was my favorite backpack until the zipper to the main compartment broke after only 3 and a half months. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the backpack
customer_reviews.text: I like the backpack. It's nice, sleek, roomy, and stylish. It is a little boxy, but other than that it feels great. One problem I had was that I used it to backpack around a lot so after two months of use, the shoulder padding area started to smell a bit (most likely from constant sweat). After washing it and sun-drying, the backpack was like new. For the price, I would recommend this backpack. Timbuk2 is great.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome backpack
customer_reviews.text: The company I work for purchased this for me for IT work. I liked the size, compartments and durability so much that I purchased one for personal use. I am a college student, and youth pastor and I needed something that would help me stay organized and protect my MacBook as well
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas L. Foster i

customer_reviews.title: Good bag.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag for your laptop thats for sure. good for a day in the city or commuting however, Not big enough for clothes and personal items for a 2 day trip. Being a big guy 6'4" 225 its not a good fit for me. I hope my wife will enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake in Japan.

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price for a nice bag
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing different price range, I decided to take my chances with timbuk2. So far the bag does its job.
customer_reviews.author: DSrun

customer_reviews.title: it's super roomy. Good quality
customer_reviews.text: HUGE ! Did not expect this bag to be as bulky. On the plus side, it's super roomy. Good quality. A number of pockets. Down side. HUGE. It'll fit a 17" MacBook if you have one. Still not quite "enough" pockets" for smaller items.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfie

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: After all the hype I heard about Timbuk2, the bag was just okay. The chest strap came off one day while I was riding my bike.
customer_reviews.author: B A

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack. It is very nice and well made. A lot of compartments to put stuffs and comfortable wearing it. Very well thought of. I would recommend this backpack for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Nice  durable bag, with small footprint
customer_reviews.text: Took some time to get used to the pockets, but after that - it's an awesome bag !
customer_reviews.author: Mitya

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, highly satisfied after checking whether my laptop ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, highly satisfied after checking whether my laptop would fit or not (T540p). Lots of spaces to use and the build quality is sturdy, highly recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Mohamad Itani

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight backpack, fits easily under the seat of an airplane while holding all of my belongings
customer_reviews.author: Monitor

customer_reviews.title: Color doesnt match
customer_reviews.text: The Ironside color is not represented well in the picture, the actual color is closer to grey. Certainly not the bright white shown. Edit: Looks like the picture was changed to represent the color better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag for 17 inch Laptops
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, well fabricated and held more than I thought it would from some reviews here. A Dell 7710 laptop fits...barely. It is a snug fit, and its a bit tight just to get it past the laptop compartment zipper that should open a bit more. But it does fit well once it is inside the space for the computer. It also has a bottle opener on the front, just in case you need to open a beer between meetings.
customer_reviews.author: Austin H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for college. It is lightweight and has plenty of room for anything I would ever need for class. The water bottle compartment is perfect for my hydroflask. The laptop compartment is well padded, I feel very confident having my 13" computer in there. They managed to make the whole backpack very spacious but thin and sleek at the same time. The only thing I would say to be cautious about when considering this is that the straps are very close together so if you have broad shoulders it might feel a bit tight. Other than that, I would definitely say that I do not need to buy a new backpack for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Alex RayTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: I love this brand simply cause they know how you take ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand simply cause they know how you take care of electronic devices I put all my laptop accessories in here and I'm always ready when I work on the go
customer_reviews.author: Aegisbushido

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lil bulkier than I would like but awesome I could fit two laptop one mac 13' and chrome book
customer_reviews.author: affandi

customer_reviews.title: It was a nice backpack but was too big for me so I ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a nice backpack but was too big for me so I returned it. I wrote an earlier review for the wrong backpack sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Lan

customer_reviews.title: The perfect bag for short business trips that doubles as your everyday laptop bag
customer_reviews.text: The perfect hybrid between a laptop bag and an overnight bag. Holds your work stuff and a change of clothes (including shoes, depending on the shoes. Dress shoes are a struggle)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, pockety, 15" laptop - and a bottle opener.
customer_reviews.text: The Timbuk2 has been ideal so far - good weight distribution, rugged construction, and enough pockets for my needs. The cable pocket is especially useful in its design and placement. The only question I have is - why does there appear to be a bottle opener attached to it permanently?! It will take a few years before I can see whether the bag can last, but it's doing well so far compared to some of my other backpacks.
customer_reviews.author: Mak K. Loong

customer_reviews.title: i love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: i love this backpack. it fits a laptop well and has many different zipper compartments to put both large and small items in.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The material feels cheap, though on sale probably what you would expect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleek backpack
customer_reviews.text: Looks sleek on the outside, and has enough pockets for all that i want to carry and keep separated.
customer_reviews.author: BourneUltimatum

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is exactly what I wanted. My MacBook 13 fits easily in the protective section, all my chargers have a safe home, there are other handy miscellaneous pockets, the material is high quality, and I can fit plenty of folders and files in the main compartment. And my favorite thing is that it has a slim, professional looking profile. Like someone else said in the comments, you don't look like a 7th grader when you walk into a room. I'd buy this pack again in a second.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Dahlen

customer_reviews.title: Feels really light and comfortable on my aging back
customer_reviews.text: Lots of storage. Feels really light and comfortable on my aging back.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M Klun

customer_reviews.title: Lots of useful pockets. Didn't realize it had a bottle opener ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of useful pockets. Didn't realize it had a bottle opener on one of the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Sean

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the compact style of this backpack, but really liked the great design!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Renteria

customer_reviews.title: I am satisfied with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Took this bag on a work trip abroad. After a week of use, I am satisfied with the purchase. I like all the small pouches that are good for putting your passport or other items for quick access. The arm padding is comfortable. My favorite feature is the water bottle holder which securely held my 1L Nalgene.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Volny

customer_reviews.title: useful. exactly what Ive expected
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, a lot of space for laptop and several gadgets, papers. quite good for regular travels and commute.
customer_reviews.author: KONSTANTIN

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: Small form factor and light, yet holds everything I need. Large enough to hold everything I need. The organizer in the front pocket seems a bit cheap/ flimsy. Otherwise great product, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Noor Syed

customer_reviews.title: Awesome brand. Great product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome backpack. Perfect size for a student or business person on the go. Super high quality materials. I abuse this thing and it handles it super well.
customer_reviews.author: General King Merchandise

customer_reviews.title: Low profile bag for commuting. I fit my slim ...
customer_reviews.text: Low profile bag for commuting. I fit my slim lunch bag and two water bottles in the padded section where a small laptop would normally go. There is another zippered compartment for paperwork. The side pocket for a water bottle is too small for the camelback style water bottle I use so I store my keys there.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Quality over quantity
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and durability. Only thing I would say I don't like is that the base sags when you out stuff in it. I wish there was something to prevent that from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Louigene

customer_reviews.title: Large Enough to Hold Oversized Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son to carry his Lenovo laptop with him for grad school. He absolutely loves it. It holds his oversized laptop and still has plenty of room for his books and supplies. It also looks great and although I can see this being unisex it really is rather masculine looking.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, functional, and versatile
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag for school, work, and travel. I love the design and there’s plenty of compartments with a surprising amount of space. Would highly recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Roomy
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack tons of room without looking bulky. Love the seperate pocket for laptop.
customer_reviews.author: William Hinton Jr

customer_reviews.title: I gave this bag four stars because the capacity for textbooks is small however you will feel that it looks nice when you wear it
customer_reviews.text: I chose this bag because the space for laptop is very protected by thick foams. When I tried this bag for the first time, the shoulder part was giving me too much pressure but as I used over two weeks now it is gone. I gave this bag four stars because the capacity for textbooks is small however you will feel that it looks nice when you wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Joon

customer_reviews.title: it can be improved
customer_reviews.text: Nice with small details that can be improved. For instance one of the zippers doesn't move as it should; a lot of airports don't accept the TSA approved "seal" since it doesn't "split"... However is sturdy and with a lot of pockets and good organization
customer_reviews.author: Mariano

customer_reviews.title: Inner padding changed
customer_reviews.text: One reason that I bought the product is inner square material padding, but it replaced with plain padding so a bit disappointed. It would better to update the product images since it's so misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Rasanjaya Lakmal Subasinghe

customer_reviews.title: Good light/slim backpack
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact, just large enough as a light daily backpack for work or school. Laptop compartment has a suspended design that will cushion accidental drops. Construction and materials are good, but zippers tend to stick a little. This may improve with use.
customer_reviews.author: GoCubs1908

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed, stylish bag for the office commuter.
customer_reviews.text: Great stylish bag for the office. I researched many bags and kept coming back to this backpack. Love that there are plenty of compartments to hold all of your necessities and I appreciate that it is not bulky, and very well made. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: M_C

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy if the year
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something professional and functional for work. This is the best designed bag I’ve ever had. Light, sturdy and well designed for anything you could want to throw in it
customer_reviews.author: Jack Suba

customer_reviews.title: My best buy from Amazon yet
customer_reviews.text: My best buy from Amazon yet! This backpack is sturdy and fashionable; I take it to the office every day. It has plenty of space and I make good use of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Pena

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, fits a lot more stuff than initially thought
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Looks good, fits a lot more stuff than initially thought, feels like quality materials and stitching Cons: Straps could be a little wider, water bottle pouch should be deeper and there should be another on the other side
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: It’s very durable!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this bag! It’s so stylish but still very durable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Must
customer_reviews.text: It's like a tank. Lots of usable pockets and zippers for fast access. Ideal for commuting or a carry-on.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work and love it! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: dschau

customer_reviews.title: Quality commuter backpack
customer_reviews.text: The number of pockets for organization is great but the main compartment isn't very large if you are traveling and pushing light
customer_reviews.author: RE

customer_reviews.title: Good pocket and handle placement
customer_reviews.text: Good pocket and handle placement. Slim, but can expand out for a weeks worth of bachelor level groceries. My daily goto bag.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sikes

customer_reviews.title: This is a great business bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great business bag. Note I would not recommend as a student's bag but as far more functional briefcase, this bag is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Paschoal

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Rugged. A little smaller than I would like, but it works well for travel as a result. Makes me pick and choose what I pack. What isn't necessary, doesn't go.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Wender

customer_reviews.title: Fits big laptops really snuggly
customer_reviews.text: Just got this delivered and I'm relieved to say that it fits my razer blade pro albeit very tightly. My only complaint is that there doesn't seem to be much padding around the edges of the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Justin D Wai

customer_reviews.title: Space
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. Easy to carry, tons of room. Great for quick work trips and even the gym.
customer_reviews.author: MG2018

product_meta.title: Timbuk2 Q Laptop Backpack
product_meta.description: The Timbuk2 Q is a compact daypack that is great for quick trips or daily use. Super lightweight Mission6 nylon fabric for added durability. Padded, low profile internal laptop compartment for full protection without the bulk. Timbuk2's trademarked Swing Around Access; grab your laptop without taking off your pack. Lightweight ergonomic shoulder straps are designed for a comfortable and snug fit. Multiple grab straps for easy lifting. Solid internal volume for carrying your daily goods. Super easy-access internal organization area for pens and such. Small external zipper pocket for keys and change. Smart power brick pocket remembers where your cords are so you don't have to. Weight: 1.90 lbs.(0.86kg). Comfortably fits 15" laptop. Dimensions: 18.50"(h) x 12.60"(w) x 5.10"(d).
feature_bullets: THE Q LAPTOP PACK: One of our most widely reputed laptop backpacks

KEEP IT ORGANIZED: Front zip pocket for keeping small items in check; Large main compartment for books, jacket, and other carry-on essentials; Secure zip pocket for earbuds, stylus, cards, and cash; Smart power brick pocket remembers where your cords are so you don't have to; Tricot-lined floating pocket protects sunglasses or smartphone

CLEVER EXTRAS: Elasticized external side pocket for water bottle or U-lock; On-strap bottle opener for party tricks and quick refreshment; Reinforced grab handles on all sides for an easy heave-ho; Vista loop for attaching blinky bike lights; Padded front pocket offers protection for laptops or tablets; Padded, tricot-lined laptop compartment (compatible with up to 17" laptop)

MATERIALS & FIT: Custom Timbuk2 print liner; Channeled airmesh ventilated back panel; Custom-fit strap design for a truer, more comfortable fit; Grab your laptop without taking off your bag; Main body material is rugged 150D Poly Tweed

LIFETIME WARRANTY: Timbuk2 stands behind the legendary quality and craftsmanship of all our products; We also embrace the wild, twisty ways of life; If there is a defect in the materials or workmanship we will repair the bag at our discretion for the lifetime of the product

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
